title: Components
description: Yamada UI provides prebuilt components to help you build projects faster.

title: AspectRatio
description: `AspectRatio` is a component for embedding things like videos and maps while maintaining the aspect ratio.

title: Box
description: `Box` is the most abstract component on which all other components are built. By default, it renders a `div` element.

title: Center
description: `Center` is a component that aligns the child elements in the center within the component.

title: Container
description: `Container` is a component used as a general division element. By default, it renders the `section` element.

title: Divider
description: `Divider` is a component that represents a division between elements.

title: Flex
description: `Flex` is a component that sets `flex` to `Box`. Also, convenient style shorthand is available.

title: Grid
description: `Grid` is a component for managing grid layouts. It also comes with handy style shorthand.

title: Layout
description: Components for building the layout of the project, such as `Box` and `Stack`, are available.

title: Stack
description: `Stack` is a component that groups elements and provides space between child elements.

title: Add a dividing line between child elements

hierarchy.lv3: Add a dividing line between child elements

title: Wrap
description: `Wrap` is a component that has `wrap` set on `Flex`. It inherits convenient style shorthand from `Flex`

description: Learn the applications of themes, styles, responsive, dark mode, and animations of Yamada UI.

description: Read a 3-minute tutorial to learn the basics of Yamada UI's themes, styles, responsiveness, dark mode, and animations.

description: How to install and use Yamada UI for each framework.

title: Getting Started with Next.js
description: A guide to installing and using Yamada UI in a Next.js project.

title: Getting Started
description: How to start with Yamada UI.

title: Installation
description: How to install and use Yamada UI in the project.

title: Hooks
description: Yamada UI offers a range of handy custom hooks to expedite the construction of your projects.

title: useAnimation
description: `useAnimation` is a custom hook that implements animations similar to CSS's `keyframes`.

title: useAsync
description: `useAsync` is a custom hook that executes an asynchronous function and tracks its state.

title: useBoolean
description: `useBoolean` is a custom hook used to manage boolean values using `on`, `off`, and `toggle` functions.

title: useBreakpointValue
description: `useBreakpointValue` is a custom hook that returns the value of the current breakpoint from the provided object. This hook monitors changes in the window size and returns the appropriate value.

title: useBreakpoint
description: `useBreakpoint` is a custom hook that returns the current breakpoint. This hook monitors changes in the window size and returns the appropriate value.

title: useClipboard
description: `useClipboard` is a custom hook that performs the process of copying a value to the clipboard.

title: useColorModeValue
description: `useColorModeValue` is a custom hook that returns the value for the current color mode from the provided values.

title: useColorMode
description: `useColorMode` is a custom hook that returns the current color mode.

title: useDisclosure
description: `useDisclosure` is a custom hook that helps handle common open, close or toggle scenarios. It can be used to control components such as `Modal`, `Dialog`, `Drawer`, etc.

title: useDynamicAnimation
description: `useDynamicAnimation` is a custom hook used to switch animations.

title: useHover
description: `useHover` is a custom hook that detects whether the pointer has moved over or left an element.

title: useIdle
description: `useIdle` is a custom hook that detects whether the user has been idle for a certain amount of time in milliseconds.

title: useInterval
description: `useInterval` is a custom hook that runs a function at a specified interval.

title: useLoading
description: `useLoading` is a custom hook that controls the loading of the application.

title: useLocalStorage
description: `useLocalStorage` is a custom hook for storing, updating, and retrieving values in local storage.

title: useMediaQuery
description: `useMediaQuery` is a custom hook that detects whether it matches a single or multiple media queries.

title: useNotice
description: `useNotice` is a custom hook that controls the notifications of the application.

title: useOS
description: `useOS` is a custom hook that returns the user's OS.

title: useOutsideClick
description: `useOutsideClick` is a custom hook that detects click events outside of an element.

title: usePrevious
description: `usePrevious` is a custom hook for obtaining the previous value.

title: useResizeObserver
description: `useResizeObserver` is a custom hook that tracks changes in the size and position of an element.

title: useTheme
description: `useToken` is a custom hook that retrieves a theme and returns a function to switch the theme.

title: useTimeout
description: `useTimeout` is a custom hook that executes a function after a specified number of milliseconds.

title: useToken
description: `useToken` is a custom hook that retrieves tokens from the theme.

title: useUpdateEffect
description: `useUpdateEffect` is a custom hook that skips side effects on the initial render, and only runs side effects when the dependency array changes.

title: useValue
description: `useValue` is a custom hook that combines `useBreakpointValue` and `useColorModeValue`.

title: useWindowEvent
description: `useWindowEvent` is a custom hook that assigns a specified event listener to `window`.

title: Animation
description: Yamada UI supports ready-to-use animations.

title: CLI
description: Generate types of customized themes using CLI commands.

title: Color Mode
description: All components of Yamada UI support dark mode.
